In general, I think the scariest thing ever is what I like to call “Coming at you from far away” — think It Follows — but I rewatched Zodiac and Memories of Murder this week, and actually the scariest thing is “Coming at you through the tall grass.”

#25.  Memories of Murder (2003)

Bong Joon Ho’s film is darkly funny and very watchable.  You can sense the desperation of the detectives, who have different methods of going about the case, as they try to hunt the elusive serial killer. 8/10 https://t.co/jBCahq49nl

@LaDeeDaKY @johnpavlovitz It was the heydey if disco, so I was out dancing most nights. In my late 40's, it was one of the dance classes I took. It brought back great memories, so we threw a disco themed Murder Mystery party to re-live our youth once more.

This morning threw up memories of protests from one Delhi winter. 

This afternoon brought the news of the brutal murder of Anis Khan, a familiar name in student politics, leader of the 137 day long movement at Aaliah University.

I still have flashes of memories. I remember returning from school in November 2002. Everywhere there were talks about a murder in the next village. Someone was strangled on his farm. A few hours later we learned that that "someone" was my grandfather. I was 14.
